page.title: 06THE BRIDGE
page.content: The{Bridge}is one of the most important structures in the town which grew up because of it.It lies on the{ {A39 trunk road}and is the lowest bridge on the{River Camel}and there are no other bridges for several miles.It joins the two halves of the town of{Wadebridge.}This medieval bridge was built in{1485}and was{96m} long and{2.7m}wide with 17 Gothic arches.After the first widening in{ {1852-3}it was{4.5m}wide.It was widened again in{1963}and is now{11.5m}wide. The bridge is made of local stone with granite coping stones.Man made islands were constructed to increase the river flow.The swans nest every year on the islands.The bridge is lit by sodium lights and there are hanging baskets of flowers on the lamp posts every summer.
